The gent who rung me up though was quite kind, they were quick to remove our dishes, but didn't rush us along, and you can't be the sunlight that pours in their second story windows. I just don't know if fruit and friendly faces are enough to make me return. (And I like fruit! Friendly people too!)

This is my favorite place to get breakfast in Madison- or anywhere for that matter. They have amazing breakfast scramblers. The food has minor ups and downs. When it's up, it's the best. But even when it's down it's better than most other places. 

Their non-breakfast food is good too. They have good pies, chili, etc.
My boyfriend and I loved this location. Our server was very nice and quick. Great food and not too expensive. Very close to the water too so it's a nice area to walk around.

I love this place; I remember coming here for as long as I can remember! They have a great variety of breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They also have great options for people are vegetarians and vegans. The chili and the Cajun shrimp sandwich are spectacular. 

Sunroom Cafe is located on the second floor on state street which makes it an ideal place to be on game days to watch people strolling in there red and white. It has a lot of natural light with lots of windows along a wall. The bathroom is down the hall from when you get up the stairs. To me, everything about this place screams madison. It's so quaint and cozy.

I'm updating my review. Still four stars but I'm a bit of a bigger fan now. Now having gone there a second time, I get this a bit more. When you know what to do as far as ordering, the process is a lot less uncomfortable and intense. 

A friend and I went here for lunch the other day. It was still busy but plenty of places for the two of us to sit. Before going there this time, I looked at the menu on their website. DO THIS. Seriously! They have SO MUCH FOOD. It's overwhelming trying to read everything when you're there as you're standing in line in a crowded space.

I ordered the "big bowl" of vegetarian chili. Boy, was it big. And delicious! Both my friend and I really enjoyed our meals (she got a club with turkey and bacon and avocado on it), the food came out fast, and it was just over $20 for the both of us with a tip.

I have now had breakfast AND lunch here and I'm glad I gave it a second try because I think I could really grow to love this place!

I recommend trying it out!

Nice spot for brunch after a long night celebrating Halloween.
I got the smoked salmon omelette. The eggs were kind of weird, but it was delicious nonetheless.

We had a part of 7 people and they put at us at table that I can only imagine was intended for 4. The place was packed and we were starving, so I'm just glad we got to sit and eat.

Sometimes it's nice to be on State Street without feeling like you're on State Street. 

Sunroom Cafe fits the bill, since it's on the second floor and gets so much sunlight. If you've been in State Street Brats, it's like emerging from the dank and stale bowels of beery hell into a sunny and cheerful heaven where Jesus is really a hippy and possibly sports dreads.

My only complaint would be that it is located on the second floor, forcing me to climb stairs and burn precious calories. But then again, that's a good excuse to claim hunger. 

The food is pretty good here, particularly if you are a non-meat eater. This is a good place to bring your parents or visiting guests, if you want a tidy spot to eat.

I've never been there for lunch or dinner but I've heard it's not that good. However, their breakfast food is PHENOMENAL. I've tried many different things and they're all great. Coffee drinks and bakery items are all great too. Breakfast potatoes used to be amazing but they've been hit or miss more recently. The fruit cups always have a good variety of fresh fruit and are so tasty. This was always my go-to brunch place in Madison, and now that I've graduated, I make sure to go to Sunroom whenever I'm back. Also, now that I'm a real adult I'm realizing that their prices are a steal!

I was taken aback by the entrance and how the signs instruct you to go upstairs to Sunroom Cafe. If my friend hadn't recommended it for breakfast I most likely would not have gone up since peering up the stairs it looked kind of sketchy.

Once you reach the top of the stairs, the door to the right opens up to a simplistic cute cafe. Tables and chairs are spread throughout the cafe with paintings on the wall. People are socializing over brunch, reading a book/paper or tapping away on their laptop.

Order up at the counter and then your name is called when your food is ready. Food is incredibly cheap and simple - two eggs, potatoes and bacon were $3.50 and then another $1.50 for a single pancake. Wow. Price is right and the atmosphere is cozy.

Went here for brunch recently with a large group, it was great to have tofu options on a brunch menu!  I got the Tofu Deluxe Scrambler and it was pretty good,.  Everyone else liked what they ordered and the menu was diverse enough to support our group of vegetarians, kids and non-vegetarians.  The atmosphere was good for a brunch too, up on the second floor off the street with big windows.

A little hidden place, yet surprisingly still very busy on the weekends with lines sometimes forming down the block.  They offer your usual breakfast combinations, ensuring that they do it all very well and provides a refreshing taste with every dish they serve. The staff is really welcoming and the atmosphere is very quaint. I really enjoy their roasted potatoes! It is very well-cooked and well-seasoned - a perfect compliment to all the dishes they serve. The Santa Fe Fritata comes topped with a guacamole that tastes really fresh! Pro-Tip: if you strike out with waiting times on other breakfast restaurants on state street, this is a really good option to check out, since the entrance is a little bit hard to spot and can be easily missed by many.

Sunroom is cozy and has great food! It's a great selection of the line isn't the whole way down the staircase. 

My favorite time to visit Sunroom is weekday mornings (see detail above). They offer great breakfast and lunch options, although I've only ever tried the breakfast. 

On my most recent visit, I got the huevos rancheros, which was excellent. I thought using their lunch chili as the ranchero sauce might be a cheap shortcut, but it worked out very well and had a lot of flavor. 

You order at the counter, grab a seat, then wait for your name to be called. 

I used the WiFi, but had to ask someone for the password. Could you post it somewhere?

Wasn't Sunroom the original place that served magic coffee?! That might be a myth. 

It's a State Street staple that's definitely worth checking out.

Charming, sunny upstairs room with pretty good, straightforward, slightly hippie food:  salads, sandwiches, omelets, soups, with lots of vegetarian choices.  Beware of long waits at lunchtime whenever school is in session.  This place is more popular for brunch than dinner, but I actually like their dinner better; their breakfasts are a bit small, and come with potatoes cut into huge chunks which are kind of unseasoned and boring in the middle.  At dinner, on the other hand, there's a broad, multi-ethnic array of hearty pastas and sandwiches -- nothing fancy, nothing you couldn't make at home, but somehow utterly satisfying.  Favorite dishes here:  greek pasta, and sun scone (only when fresh.)

I came here for the first time for a brunch double date before embarking on a Maxwell Street Days shopping spree and had a nice experience. We expected it to be really busy since I heard it was small and it was 11:00am on a Saturday with State Street packed full of shoppers, but we only waited in line for about 5 minutes (you order at the counter and seat yourself). The food came out very fast as well. I ordered the Denver Omelette which comes with ham, cheddar cheese, mushrooms, green onion, tomatoes, green peppers, and toast & potatoes on the side. It was a pretty standard dish, but quite tasty nonetheless. There were a lot of other good-sounding food items and smoothies on the menu though that I would definitely want to come back and try.

Sunroom is somewhat of a hidden gem as the restaurant is upstairs and has no real storefront. It is a pretty small place, but has bright, warm lighting which makes the atmosphere warm and cozy. Glad I found you Sunroom, I will be back!

The banana wheat pancakes would make Jack Johnson proud.
 
I knew I had to try em after seeing the dish featured in Madison Magazine's 13 Tastiest Pancakes, and I'm glad I did.

Don't go in expecting your typical light and fluffy, sweet pancakes though, as these guys are dense and hearty and sure FILL YOU UP.

The cakes themselves aren't exactly sweet, but the huge slices of warmed banana interspersed throughout the batter make up for it. No syrup necessary. 

Other than the pancakes, I've also tried a slice of chocolate hazelnut pie from here, which speaks for itself - its delicious chocolateyness certainly goes without saying.

Excited for my next visit so I can check out their more savory fare!
Usually pretty bus, like most brunch places in Madison, but the atmosphere is very chill and unpretentious, and the food is solid.  Their omelettes are on point, try the one with feta and spinach.

I always love their daily specials: be it shrimp pasta, or pizza
Their Dutch Mocha is all good!
This place can be crowded on weekends, so come early if you want to enjoy your meals while overlooking State street from your spot. 
The service is good. It's actually self-service if you have less than 6 people in your table. 
I tried their asparagus pasta, and it was good. Tho, the after effect was not that pleasant (I hope you know what I mean). 
On my next visits, I tried something else: pancake, omelette, tuna sandwich. And yes, they are good, good, good :)
The place is convenient too (On State street!) so, feeling hungry after studying the whole morning? come here and your tummy will be happy and smiley!

Seriously, every fucking eatery in town now offers a garlic-y burger with some bleu cheese on it.  I think you can get a McGarlic at McDonald's now. 

Un-original menu offerings withstanding, Sunroom Cafe is a nice little place to grab a bite to eat on State St. if you're looking for something:

A.  not a chain
B. kinda granola

A UW tradition, that serves healthy food in good portions at great prices.  Lovely vegetarian options, such as the veggie chili and beautiful salads.  The Arab Salad offers hummus, baba ganoush and tabouli  on a bed of gorgeous greens with fresh pita.  Meat eaters will not be disappointed by the offerings here in sandwiches and pasta dishes.  Nice breakfasts also.  Very popular so expect lines during peak hours, but things move along quickly.  During the day you pick up your food at the counter, but at dinner there is table service.  Another thing I enjoy about Sunroom is that (unlike most restaurants at this price and service point) they do not use any disposable plates or flatware--just paper napkins.  Good drink menu of sodas to smoothies to some wine and beer.

I love Sunroom! It is such a cozy, truly sunny place to sit and dine above the chaos of State Street. There is always a great display of artwork on show, usually by local artist. And you are sure to find yourself amogst an interesing crowd of students, professors, and stumble-ins. Get a window seat if you can!

The food is neither terrible nor great. The menus are extensive and offer an excellent selection of vegetarian options. The food is always fresh, but what you see is pretty much what you get. The prices and the portion sizes are small. Nevertheless, one of my favorite places to grab a cuppa and sit back and relax...

Came here after being quite hungover from Freakfest (which was a blast by the way and I highly recommend going). While we had to wait on a flight of steps for about 40 minutes to get seated, the food was well worth it, they serve bloody Mary's and mimosas, and the service was great. 

We were lucky enough to get seated by a window which had wonderful morning views of downtown. 

I had the tofu scramble with a side of avocado (always a breakfast side staple) and it was delicious. However, I opted for the spicy option and had to put hot sauce on for a decent kick. Our waitress was lovely and we were checked on by other waitstaff as well. 

4 stars because of the women's bathroom and decor-- the women's stall was teeny tiny, my chair was quite uncomfortable, and both the bathroom and restaurant had no updates in recent years. Normally I don't mind but when it affects my comfort level, I do. 

Overall, this is a fantastic Sunday brunch stop.

Ooh, baby, do you know what that's worth?
Ooh heaven is a place on earth... and it's called SUNROOM CAFE!

The ONLY place for breakfast on State Street.  Great staff.  Great art (switches all the time).  Great menu selection.  GREAT FOOD!  The atmosphere is awesome.  I HIGHLY recommend this place for any college student and/or family visiting on the weekend.

BLESS THE SUNROOM CAFE!
